verses.kjv: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam began Abijah to reign over Judah.
verses.web: In the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam, Abijah began to reign over Judah.
verses.ct: Abijah became king of Judah in the 18th year of King Jeroboam's reign.

verses.kjv: He reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also was Michaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
verses.web: He reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Micaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. There was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
verses.ct: He ruled in Jerusalem for 3 years. His mother was Michaiah, the daughter of Uriel from Gibeah. War broke out between Abijah and Jeroboam.

verses.kjv: And Abijah set the battle in array with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men: Jeroboam also set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, being mighty men of valour.
verses.web: Abijah joined battle with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men; and Jeroboam set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, who were mighty men of valor.
verses.ct: Abijah assembled his army for battle — 400,000 elite fighting men. Jeroboam lined up against him with 800,000 of his own elite warriors, all of them fierce soldiers.

verses.kjv: And Abijah stood up upon mount Zemaraim, which is in mount Ephraim, and said, Hear me, thou Jeroboam, and all Israel;
verses.web: Abijah stood up on Mount Zemaraim, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, and said, “Hear me, Jeroboam and all Israel:
verses.ct: Abijah stood on Mount Zemaraim in the hill country of Ephraim and called out, "Listen to me, Jeroboam, and all of Israel!

verses.kjv: Ought ye not to know that the LORD God of Israel gave the kingdom over Israel to David for ever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
verses.web: Ought you not to know that LORD, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom over Israel to David forever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
verses.ct: Don't you know that the LORD, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom of Israel to David and his descendants forever through a covenant of salt — an unbreakable agreement?

verses.kjv: Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, is risen up, and hath rebelled against his lord.
verses.web: Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up, and rebelled against his lord.
verses.ct: Yet Jeroboam son of Nebat, who was nothing more than a servant of David's son Solomon, rose up and rebelled against his master.

verses.kjv: And there are gathered unto him vain men, the children of Belial, and have strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and tenderhearted, and could not withstand them.
verses.web: Worthless men were gathered to him, wicked fellows who strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and tender hearted, and could not withstand them.
verses.ct: Then a crowd of worthless, wicked men rallied around him and overpowered Rehoboam, Solomon's son. Rehoboam was young and inexperienced at the time and didn't have the strength to stand against them.

verses.kjv: And now ye think to withstand the kingdom of the LORD in the hand of the sons of David; and ye be a great multitude, and there are with you golden calves, which Jeroboam made you for gods.
verses.web: “Now you intend to withstand the kingdom of LORD in the hand of the sons of David. You are a great multitude, and the golden calves which Jeroboam made you for gods are with you.
verses.ct: Now you think you can challenge the kingdom of the LORD, which belongs to David's descendants? Sure, you have a massive army — and you have those golden calves that Jeroboam made for you as gods.

verses.kjv: Have ye not cast out the priests of the LORD, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and have made you priests after the manner of the nations of other lands? so that whosoever cometh to consecrate himself with a young bullock and seven rams, the same may be a priest of them that are no gods.
verses.web: Haven’t you driven out the priests of LORD, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and made priests for yourselves according to the ways of the peoples of other lands? Whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bull and seven rams may be a priest of those who are no gods.
verses.ct: Haven't you driven out the LORD's priests, the descendants of Aaron, along with the Levites? And you've replaced them with your own priests, just like the pagan nations do. Anyone who shows up with a young bull and 7 rams can become a priest of your so-called gods — which aren't gods at all.

verses.kjv: But as for us, the LORD is our God, and we have not forsaken him; and the priests, which minister unto the LORD, are the sons of Aaron, and the Levites wait upon their business:
verses.web: “But as for us, LORD is our God, and we have not forsaken him. We have priests serving LORD, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites in their work;
verses.ct: But as for us, the LORD is our God, and we haven't abandoned him. Our priests who serve the LORD are descendants of Aaron, and the Levites carry out their duties faithfully.

verses.kjv: And they burn unto the LORD every morning and every evening burnt sacrifices and sweet incense: the shewbread also set they in order upon the pure table; and the candlestick of gold with the lamps thereof, to burn every evening: for we keep the charge of the LORD our God; but ye have forsaken him.
verses.web: and they burn to LORD every morning and every evening burnt offerings and sweet incense. They also set the show bread in order on the pure table; and the lamp stand of gold with its lamps, to burn every evening; for we keep the instruction of LORD our God, but you have forsaken him.
verses.ct: Every morning and every evening they offer burnt offerings and fragrant incense to the LORD. They arrange the sacred bread on the pure table and light the gold lampstand with its lamps every evening. We follow the instructions of the LORD our God, but you have abandoned him.

verses.kjv: And, behold, God himself is with us for our captain, and his priests with sounding trumpets to cry alarm against you. O children of Israel, fight ye not against the LORD God of your fathers; for ye shall not prosper.
verses.web: Behold, God is with us at our head, and his priests with the trumpets of alarm to sound an alarm against you. Children of Israel, don’t fight against LORD, the God of your fathers; for you will not prosper.”
verses.ct: Look — God himself is with us as our leader, and his priests stand ready with their trumpets to sound the battle cry against you. People of Israel, do not fight against the LORD, the God of your ancestors. You will not win."

verses.kjv: But Jeroboam caused an ambushment to come about behind them: so they were before Judah, and the ambushment was behind them.
verses.web: But Jeroboam caused an ambush to come about behind them; so they were before Judah, and the ambush was behind them.
verses.ct: While Abijah was speaking, Jeroboam had sent troops to circle around behind them. So Judah was caught with Jeroboam's main force in front and an ambush behind.

verses.kjv: And when Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind: and they cried unto the LORD, and the priests sounded with the trumpets.
verses.web: When Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind them; and they cried to LORD, and the priests sounded with the trumpets.
verses.ct: When Judah looked around, they realized they were surrounded — enemies in front and behind. They cried out to the LORD, and the priests blew the trumpets.

verses.kjv: Then the men of Judah gave a shout: and as the men of Judah shouted, it came to pass, that God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
verses.web: Then the men of Judah gave a shout. As the men of Judah shouted, God struck Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
verses.ct: Then the men of Judah raised a battle shout. The moment they shouted, God struck down Jeroboam and all of Israel before Abijah and Judah.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel fled before Judah: and God delivered them into their hand.
verses.web: The children of Israel fled before Judah, and God delivered them into their hand.
verses.ct: The Israelite army fled from Judah, and God handed them over to defeat.

verses.kjv: And Abijah and his people slew them with a great slaughter: so there fell down slain of Israel five hundred thousand chosen men.
verses.web: Abijah and his people killed them with a great slaughter, so five hundred thousand chosen men of Israel fell down slain.
verses.ct: Abijah and his men inflicted a devastating blow — 500,000 of Israel's elite soldiers fell dead that day.

verses.kjv: Thus the children of Israel were brought under at that time, and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied upon the LORD God of their fathers.
verses.web: Thus the children of Israel were brought under at that time, and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied on LORD, the God of their fathers.
verses.ct: Israel was humbled that day, and Judah won the victory because they relied on the LORD, the God of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Bethel with the towns thereof, and Jeshanah with the towns thereof, and Ephrain with the towns thereof.
verses.web: Abijah pursued Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Bethel with its villages, Jeshanah with its villages, and Ephron with its villages.
verses.ct: Abijah chased after Jeroboam and captured several cities from him: Bethel and its surrounding towns, Jeshanah and its surrounding towns, and Ephrain and its surrounding towns.

verses.kjv: Neither did Jeroboam recover strength again in the days of Abijah: and the LORD struck him, and he died.
verses.web: Jeroboam didn’t recover strength again in the days of Abijah. LORD struck him, and he died.
verses.ct: Jeroboam never regained his power during Abijah's lifetime. Eventually the LORD struck him down, and he died.

verses.kjv: But Abijah waxed mighty, and married fourteen wives, and begat twenty and two sons, and sixteen daughters.
verses.web: But Abijah grew mighty, and took for himself fourteen wives, and became the father of twenty-two sons, and sixteen daughters.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Abijah grew powerful. He married 14 wives and fathered 22 sons and 16 daughters.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Abijah, and his ways, and his sayings, are written in the story of the prophet Iddo.
verses.web: The rest of the acts of Abijah, his ways, and his sayings are written in the commentary of the prophet Iddo.
verses.ct: Everything else about Abijah's reign — his actions and his teachings — is recorded in the writings of the prophet Iddo.
